intro: Schizochilus galpinii, commonly known as the Galpin's schizochilus, is a rare and unique plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
